result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lakeya Shantel McDonald

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lakeya Shantel McDonald not in court, in custody.  Attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre appeared by video for Lakeya Shantel McDonald.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Parties are pursuing a global resolution in Branch 02.
Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Due to Court being down 10/7/2022, Court allows for reschedule of the 10/7/2022 status conference to 11/2/2022 at 9:30 a.m. by Zoom. Parties notified via email.

Defendant Lakeya Shantel McDonald not in court, in custody.  Attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre appeared by video for Lakeya Shantel McDonald. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery and offer. Discussion held. Defendant has a felony matter in Branches 17 AND 2 and will be seeking a global offer and request the court to authorize transfer. 
Court authorizes transfer to Branches 17 AND 2 for purposes of a global resolution, if accepted. 
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Lakeya Shantel McDonald in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Lakeya Shantel McDonald in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lakeya Shantel McDonald appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
